definition:
Let $E_1 \overset{\pi_1}\to B_1$ and $E_2 \overset{\pi_2}\to B_2$ be
fiber bundles for which there is a continuous map $f:B_1 \to B_2$ of
base spaces. A *bundle map* (or *bundle morphism*) is a commutative
square $$\xymatrix{
E_1 \ar[r]^{\hat{f}} \ar[d]_{\pi_1} & E_2 \ar[d]^{\pi_2} \\
B_1 \ar[r]^{f} & B_2
}$$ such that the induced map $E_1 \to f^{-1}E_2$ is a homeomorphism
(here $f^{-1}E_2$ denotes the pullback of $f$ along the bundle
projection $\pi_2$).
